result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Benjimin B Condra was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Defendant Benjimin B Condra appears by video along with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews defendants petition for conditional release, questions whether counsel have agreed on a independent evaluator. Counsel have not discuss examiners. Court appoints Dr. Erik Knudson to conduct independent examination regarding defendants petition for conditional release. Report to be completed by 7/13/17. Hearing date set. Dr. Knudson can appear by phone for 8/09/17 hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Benjimin B Condra in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Court reviews letter from LLS Wendy Yang petitioning court revoke defendants conditional release and sign order for commitment. State agrees with Ms. Wangs request, makes statement. Wendy Yang of LLS testifies, sworn. Cross by Atty Erickson. Atty Pelrine makes statement in support of petition to revoke conditional release and place defendant in institutional care for treatment. Defense gives argument.  Court makes statement, revokes defendants conditional release and commits him to DHS for treatment.   Court won't enter order regarding taking of psychotropic medications, needs more information on that before ruling, that matter can be addressed at a later date.  Court signs order as presented by DHS.

Defendant Benjimin B Condra in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Discussion regarding treatment and release to the community, expresses some concerns defendant has with part of the release/treatment plan.  Atty Erickson asks court to set this matter off for 21 days so they can work out the issues. State has no objection to adjournment.  Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Benjimin B Condra in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea and makes a finding guilty but not guilty by reason of mental discease or defect. Court orders DHS to conduct a predispostion report. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 3 and 15-TR-1093 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Because of the NGI finding, Court recinds order that defendant is not eligible to vote. Court orders DHS to complete a Predisposition Report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Benjimin B Condra in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant indicates he does not qualify for PD representation. Defendant would like talk to Atty Reetz before submitting court appointed attorney form. Defendant questions whether court needs him to contact 3 attorneys before appointing someone to represent him. Court ready to appoint Atty Grant Erickson to represent defendant if that's how he wishes to proceed. Defendant would accept Atty Erickson as court appointed attorney. Court appoints Atty Grant Erickson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward atty fees. First payment due by 7/10/15.  Atty Erickson accepts court appointment. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Erickson requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
